  • Constructor Details

    • Client

      public Client(String chosenUI)
      Constructor for the Client
      Parameters:
      chosenUI - represents a CLI or a GUI.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Main method that starts by requesting whether the user wants to use a CLI or a GUI. Then, server IP and port are requested though the chosen UI, the connection is established and the ping is started. A nickname is then requested and finally the main loop of receiving server responses is started.

    • connectToLobbyServer

      private void connectToLobbyServer(String IP, int port)
      Tries to connect to the lobby server at the given address.
      Parameters:
      IP - ip to connect to
      port - port to connect to

    • tryLobbyLogin

      private void tryLobbyLogin()
      Tries to log in by sending a login user action with chosen username.

    • disconnectFromLobby

      private void disconnectFromLobby()
      Disconnects user from server.

    • connectToMatchServer

      private void connectToMatchServer(String IP, int port)
      Tries to connect to the match server at the given address.
      Parameters:
      IP - ip to connect to
      port - port to connect to

    • startPing

      private void startPing()
      Starts ping with the server to which the socket is connected.

    • stopPing

      private void stopPing()
      Stops ping with the server to which the socket is connected. Waits for the ping to have stopped before returning.

    • askCLIorGUI

      private void askCLIorGUI()
      Asks on the terminal whether the user wants to play with CLI or GUI

    • parseMessage

      private void parseMessage(Message message)
      Parses a received message.
      Parameters:
      message - a message sent by the server.

    • parseUpdate

      private void parseUpdate(Update update)
      If the server sent an update, this method parses the update based on the action taking player. If the action taking player of the update is this client, then executes in a thread queue. If it isn't, it executes on a different thread queue. This allows the Client to make request of the user and show them info in parallel.
      Parameters:
      update - the update received.

    • requestAction

      private void requestAction(Update update)
      Parses the update on the premise of making the user a request of some kind, either by directly requesting it or by enabling and disabling commands that allow the user to take an action.
      Parameters:
      update - the update received.

    • displayInfo

      private void displayInfo(Update update)
      Parses the update on the premise of showing the player some information. Nothing will be requested of the user, at most some commands will be disabled based on what action is expected to be taken.
      Parameters:
      update - the update received.

    • sendUserAction

      public void sendUserAction(UserAction userAction)
      Sends a UserAction through the socket.
      Parameters:
      userAction - the UserAction to be sen.

    • receiveMessage

      private Message receiveMessage()
      Receives a message from the server through the socket.
      Returns:
      the message received from the server, if converted successfully

    • clearScreen

      private void clearScreen()
      Clears the terminal.

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes the application.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the client state and restarts main loop.

    • fatalError

      public void fatalError(String errorDescription)
      If the client isn't being reset, it disconnects from server and forwards an error to be displayed to the user.
      Parameters:
      errorDescription - the error to be displayed.

    • logoutFromServer

      private void logoutFromServer()
      Logs out client from server by sending a logout user action.

    • disconnectFromServer

      private void disconnectFromServer()
      Disconnects client from server.
